page.title: 19Scotton Village Hall
page.content: Opened in{1976}the village hall is the centre for many Scotton activities - playgroup,Sunday School,plays,dances, meetings,parties etc.Built on land given by{Mrs M Littlewood,}the prefabricated Marley building replaced the old church hall (small and lacking in facilities).Financed partly by{ {grant aid}and partly from money raised after many years of fund raising:whist drives,sponsored walks,coffee mornings etc.Self supporting through income from letting and some fund raising,the hall is run by a management committee of representatives of village organisations and 3 elected members.In 1980 it won the{Community Council of {Lincolnshire Village Hall Competition. In 1980 the committee built a doubles hard tennis court behind the hall and this is well used all year long. {
